name: Q1 2024 Cross-Team Retrospective
content:

- QA: Lisa, Tom

- DevOps: Carlos, Maria

1. What Went Well ğŸŒŸ

-----------------

Engineering:

âœ… Successful migration to microservices

âœ… Reduced API response time by 40%

âœ… Implemented automated testing pipeline

Product/Design:

âœ… New dashboard received positive feedback

âœ… User research helped prioritize features

âœ… Design system documentation improved

QA/DevOps:

âœ… Test coverage increased to 85%

âœ… Deployment time reduced to 15 minutes

âœ… Zero critical production issues

2. Areas for Improvement ğŸ¯

------------------------

Communication:

âŒ Late design feedback causing rework

âŒ Requirements changes mid-sprint

âŒ Cross-team dependencies not clear

Technical:

âŒ Mobile app performance issues

âŒ Tech debt accumulating

3. Action Items ğŸ“‹

----------------

Process Improvements:

1. Implement RFC process for major changes

Owner: Mike

Due: April 5

2. Daily cross-team standup (15 min max)

Owner: Emma

Start: April 1

3. Bi-weekly architecture review

Owner: David

Start: April 3

Technical Tasks:

1. Mobile performance audit

Team: Rachel, Sofia

Due: April 12

2. Tech debt cleanup sprint

Team: Engineering

When: April 15-26

3. Documentation sprint

Team: All

When: May 6-10

4. Metrics & KPIs ğŸ“ˆ

----------------

Current vs Target:

```

Metric Current Target Due

----------------- -------- -------- -------

Deploy Frequency 3/week 5/week Q2

Lead Time 4 days 2 days Q2

Change Failure 8% 5% Q3

MTTR 45 min 30 min Q2

Test Coverage 85% 90% Q2

Mobile Perf Score 75 90 Q2

```

5. Team Health ğŸ’ª

--------------

Positive Trends:

- Better work-life balance

- Increased knowledge sharing

- More pair programming

Areas to Watch:

- Sprint burnout risk

- Meeting overload

- Context switching

6. Next Steps ğŸ‘£

-------------

This Week:

- Share retro notes with all teams

- Schedule action item kickoffs

- Update team OKRs

Next Month:

- Weekly progress check-ins

- Mid-quarter metrics review

- Adjust plans based on feedback

Remember:

- Focus on actionable improvements

- Celebrate small wins

- Keep communication channels open

- Follow up on action items
